description: In repeated iterations of function m->m/2 if m even, m->3m+1 if m odd, a(n) is maximum value achieved if starting from n.
comments: If a(n) exists (which is the essence of the 3x+1 "problem") then a(n) must be a multiple of 4, since if a(n) was odd then the next iteration 3*a(n)+1 would be greater than a(n), while if a(n) was twice an odd number then the next-but-one iteration (3/2)*a(n)+1 would be greater.
links: Index entries for sequences related to 3x+1 (or Collatz) problem
example: a(6)=16 since iteration starts: 6, 3, 10, 5, 16, 8, 4, 2, 1, 4, 2, 1, ... and 16 is highest value
